Legal_Issue: Whether the Board correctly applied the legal test for state protection in assessing the refugee claim
Governing_Law: The applicable law requires that states provide 'adequate protection' to citizens, not merely 'serious efforts' at protection
Decision_Outcome: The Board misstated the legal test by focusing on 'serious efforts' rather than 'adequate protection,' which influenced its decision regarding Ms. Henguva's safety in Walvis Bay
Standard_of_Review: Correct legal standard for state protection
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Application for judicial review was allowed
Review_Standard: Correct application of legal test for state protection
Applicant_Challenge: Rejection of refugee claim based on flawed legal interpretation
Court_Result: Judicial review granted; case remitted for re-determination
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Outcome: Case remitted to a differently constituted panel
Legal_Provision: Obligation to provide adequate state protection
Legal_Provision_Cited: Requirement of 'adequate protection' under refugee law
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Internal flight alternative to Walvis Bay
Applicable_Process: Refugee status determination and judicial review
Governing_Rule: The Board must apply the correct legal test of 'adequate protection'
